pokemon.name: Nidoran ♀
pokemon.description: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they'll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.

pokemon.name: Nidorina
pokemon.description: The horn on its head has atrophied. It's thought that this happens so Nidorina's children won't get poked while their mother is feeding them.

pokemon.name: Nidoqueen
pokemon.description: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.

pokemon.name: Nidoran ♂
pokemon.description: The horn on a male Nidoran's forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.

pokemon.name: Nidorino
pokemon.description: With a horn that's harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone

pokemon.name: Nidoking
pokemon.description: When it goes on a rampage, it's impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it's lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.

pokemon.name: Clefairy
pokemon.description: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

pokemon.name: Clefable
pokemon.description: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

pokemon.name: Vulpix
pokemon.description: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

pokemon.name: Jigglypuff
pokemon.description: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

pokemon.name: Wigglytuff
pokemon.description: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.

pokemon.name: Zubat
pokemon.description: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.

pokemon.name: Golbat
pokemon.description: It loves to drink other creatures' blood. It's said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it's gathered.

pokemon.name: Oddish
pokemon.description: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

pokemon.name: Gloom
pokemon.description: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

pokemon.name: Vileplume
pokemon.description: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

pokemon.name: Paras
pokemon.description: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

pokemon.name: Parasect
pokemon.description: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.

pokemon.name: Venonat
pokemon.description: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

pokemon.name: Venomoth
pokemon.description: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

pokemon.name: Diglett
pokemon.description: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

pokemon.name: Dugtrio
pokemon.description: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

pokemon.name: Meowth
pokemon.description: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

pokemon.name: Persian
pokemon.description: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

pokemon.name: Psyduck
pokemon.description: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

pokemon.name: Golduck
pokemon.description: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

pokemon.name: Mankey
pokemon.description: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

pokemon.name: Primeape
pokemon.description: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

pokemon.name: Growlithe
pokemon.description: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

pokemon.name: Arcanine
pokemon.description: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

pokemon.name: Poliwag
pokemon.description: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.

pokemon.name: Poliwhirl
pokemon.description: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl's has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.

pokemon.name: Poliwrath
pokemon.description: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.

pokemon.name: Abra
pokemon.description: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.

pokemon.name: Kadabra
pokemon.description: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.

pokemon.name: Alakazam
pokemon.description: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.

pokemon.name: Machop
pokemon.description: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.

pokemon.name: Machoke
pokemon.description: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.

pokemon.name: Machamp
pokemon.description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

pokemon.name: Bellsprout
pokemon.description: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

pokemon.name: Weepinbell
pokemon.description: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

pokemon.name: Victreebel
pokemon.description: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

pokemon.name: Tentacool
pokemon.description: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.

pokemon.name: Tentacruel
pokemon.description: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.

pokemon.name: Geodude
pokemon.description: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.

pokemon.name: Graveler
pokemon.description: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.

pokemon.name: Golem
pokemon.description: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it's exposed to air.

pokemon.name: Ponyta
pokemon.description: It can't run properly when it's newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.

pokemon.name: Rapidash
pokemon.description: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.

pokemon.name: Slowpoke
pokemon.description: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

pokemon.name: Slowbro
pokemon.description: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

pokemon.name: Magnemite
pokemon.description: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

pokemon.name: Magneton
pokemon.description: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

pokemon.name: Farfetch'd
pokemon.description: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.

pokemon.name: Doduo
pokemon.description: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

pokemon.name: Dodrio
pokemon.description: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

pokemon.name: Seel
pokemon.description: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Dewgong
pokemon.description: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

pokemon.name: Grimer
pokemon.description: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

pokemon.name: Muk
pokemon.description: It’s thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

pokemon.name: Shellder
pokemon.description: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

pokemon.name: Cloyster
pokemon.description: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

pokemon.name: Gastly
pokemon.description: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

pokemon.name: Haunter
pokemon.description: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

pokemon.name: Gengar
pokemon.description: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey’s shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

pokemon.name: Onix
pokemon.description: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.

pokemon.name: Drowzee
pokemon.description: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

pokemon.name: Hynpo
pokemon.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

pokemon.name: Krabby
pokemon.description: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

pokemon.name: Kingler
pokemon.description: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

pokemon.name: Voltorb
pokemon.description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
